GeneDef.label: skirmisher
GeneDef.description: Skirmishers tend to be extremely hard to pin down due to their dextrous nature. They leap in and out of battles with ease, and while it is minor, their ability to predict the actions of everyone near them makes them a deadly force. Lightly equipped Skirmishers will often leap to the back lines to tear apart the enemy's ranged troops, while heavily equipped Skirmishers will wade through enemies, leaping out of the way just before things really get dangerous.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: analyzer
GeneDef.description: Analyzers are capable of viewing everything around them with extreme detail, and use this power to take down foes with extreme precision.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: porter
GeneDef.description: Porters are capable of transporting large amounts of people and things from place to place with ease. While they themselves usually don't have much assistance to provide in direct combat, their abilities are still valued highly in any army or raiding party as all they require when moving large amounts of people is a person at the destination to act as a destination beacon.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: hemomancer
GeneDef.description:
Hemomancers, contrary to popular belief, don't gain their abilities from being superheroes, but from a mutated version of the hemogenic gene. This mutation initially caused extreme bloodlust, but that was removed about a decade later by introducing small portions of the superhero gene. The final version of the gene contains just enough of the superhero gene directly inside it to allow hemomancers to be classified as superheroes without actually having the superhero gene.

The prerequisite for this gene is Hemogenic, not the Superhero Gene. There will be powers in the future that require this.

Most superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

HediffDef.label: hemomancer
HediffDef.description: This pawn's ability to control blood allows them to slow the rate that they lose blood from open wounds.

GeneDef.label: pugilist
GeneDef.description: Pugilists have been called many different things throughout the years. Boxers, brawlers, and sometimes just known by the generic term martial artists, a pugilists true strength lies not in the innate powers of their archetype, but the training and equipment they use to compliment the abilities. They are often the first ones to the front lines, and the last ones to leave.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: medic
GeneDef.description: Medics often spend their life constantly moving around. Every day there's a new person to patch up, a new triage clinic to tend to, a new person to bring back from the brink of death.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: life bringer
GeneDef.description: The very existence of Life Bringers defies common sense and the natural order. Those under the Life Bringer's care will find that wounds never last long, and death is nothing more than an inconvenience.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: druid
GeneDef.description: Most believe that druids seek to have balance with nature, to ensure it is not disrupted. This belief is what caused people to begin calling Druids as such, and it was only reinforced when they found their own animals turning against them.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: electromancer
GeneDef.description: Electromancers specialize in the weaponization of electricity, from the electronics disabling EMPs to the flesh frying lightning.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: petrimancer
GeneDef.description: Petrimancers specialize in petrifying opponents, and are vital in any colony that relies on large numbers of prisoners or slaves.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: pyromancer
GeneDef.description: Pyromancer specialize in burning everything around them to ashes, and usually the only way to stop them involves a lot of fireproofing.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: cryomancer
GeneDef.description: Pyromancer specialize in inflicting debilating frostbite upon all their foes.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: caustimancer
GeneDef.description: Caustimancers specialize in throwing acid around, and frequently get banned from bars after a fight because of the mess they leave behind.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: toximancer
GeneDef.description: Toximancers tend to play more of a supporting roll on the battlefield. While their blasts may not kill anyone directly, they are excellent for forcing people to flee to new cover.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: hacker
GeneDef.description: Hackers excel when fighting mechanoids. Their excellence comes not from how much destruction they cause, but from the destruction the mechanoids can cause. All they need to do is touch the strongest mechanoid, and all that will be left is cleanup.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.

GeneDef.label: anti-hero
GeneDef.description: When all hope is lost, when the villains run rampant and unkillable monsters infest the lands, the Anti-hero will be there. They turn strengths into weakness, and tear apart their enemies with brutal efficiency. No mercy will be given, and no weakness will be left unused. Some may be unsaveable, but all are killable.\n\nMost superheroes have some archetype that they follow, from those that specialize in melee combat to those who specialize in burning everything to the ground. The specific name an archetype goes by often varies, but their overall abilities seldom change. Supers with an archetype usually aren't as burdened by the abilities that come with it, and often don't require the prerequisites that some abilities normally require. The effects, and side effects, of the abilities remain the same.
